member.name: T:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRuleCollection
member.summary: The StaticPageRuleCollection models a set of StaticPageRules in the Web.config file.
member.remarks:
The StaticPageRuleCollection is expressed in XML as:
<StaticPageRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <StaticPageRule> <StaticPageRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <StaticPageRule> ... <StaticPageRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <StaticPageRule>

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRuleCollection.Add(MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRule)
member.summary: Adds a new StaticPageRule to the collection.

member.name: P:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRuleCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a StaticPageRule at a specified ordinal index.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRule
member.summary: Represents a rewriter rule. A rewriter rule is composed of a pattern to search for and a string to replace the pattern with (if matched).

member.name: P:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRule.LookFor
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern to look for.
member.remarks:
LookFor is a regular expression pattern. Therefore, you might need to escape characters in the pattern that are reserved characters in regular expression syntax (., ?, ^, $, etc.).
The pattern is searched for using the System.Text.RegularExpression.Regex class's IsMatch() method. The pattern is case insensitive.

member.name: P:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageRule.WriteTo
member.summary: The string to replace the pattern with, if found.
member.remarks: The replacement string may use grouping symbols, like $1, $2, etc. Specifically, the System.Text.RegularExpression.Regex class's Replace() method is used to replace the match in with the value in SendTo.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageConfigurationHandler
member.summary: Deserializes the markup in Web.config into an instance of the class.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageConfigurationHandler.Create(System.Object,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.
member.remarks: Uses XML Serialization to deserialize the XML in the Web.config file into an instance.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.RewriterFactoryHandler
member.summary: Provides an HttpHandler that performs redirection.
member.remarks: The RewriterFactoryHandler checks the rewriting rules, rewrites the path if needed, and then delegates the responsibility of processing the ASP.NET page to the PageParser class (the same one used by the PageHandlerFactory class).

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.RewriterFactoryHandler.GetHandler(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetHandler is executed by the ASP.NET pipeline after the associated HttpModules have run. The job of GetHandler is to return an instance of an HttpHandler that can process the page.
member.param: The HTTP data transfer method (GET or POST)
The RawUrl of the requested resource.
The physical path to the requested resource.
member.returns: An instance that implements IHttpHandler; specifically, an HttpHandler instance returned by the PageParser class, which is the same class that the default ASP.NET PageHandlerFactory delegates to.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration settings in the Web.config for the StaticPageRule.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageConfiguration.GetConfig
member.summary: GetConfig() returns an instance of the StaticPageConfiguration class with the values populated from the Web.config file. It uses XML deserialization to convert the XML structure in Web.config into a StaticPageConfiguration instance.

member.name: P:MySoft.Web.Configuration.StaticPageConfiguration.Rules
member.summary: A instance that provides access to a set of s.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.Configuration.RewriterConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration settings in the Web.config for the RewriterRule.
member.remarks:
This class defines the structure of the Rewriter configuration file in the Web.config file. Currently, it allows only for a set of rewrite rules; however, this approach allows for customization. For example, you could provide a ruleset that doesn't use regular expression matching; or a set of constant names and values, which could then be referenced in rewrite rules.
The structure in the Web.config file is as follows:
<configuration> <configSections> <section name="RewriterConfig" type="URLRewriter.Config.RewriterConfigSerializerSectionHandler, URLRewriter" /> </configSections>
<RewriterConfig> <Rules> <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> ... <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> </Rules> </RewriterConfig>
<system.web> ... </system.web> </configuration>

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.Configuration.RewriterConfiguration.GetConfig
member.summary: GetConfig() returns an instance of the RewriterConfiguration class with the values populated from the Web.config file. It uses XML deserialization to convert the XML structure in Web.config into a RewriterConfiguration instance.

member.name: P:MySoft.Web.Configuration.RewriterConfiguration.Rules
member.summary: A instance that provides access to a set of s.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.RewriterUtils
member.summary: Provides utility helper methods for the rewriting HttpModule and HttpHandler.
member.remarks: This class is marked as internal, meaning only classes in the same assembly will be able to access its methods.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.RewriterUtils.RewriteUrl(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String)
member.param: The HttpContext object to rewrite the URL to.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.RewriterUtils.RewriteUrl(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.param: The HttpContext object to rewrite the URL to.
Returns the value of sendToUrl stripped of the querystring.
Returns the physical file path to the requested page.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.RewriterUtils.ResolveUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a URL into one that is usable on the requesting client.
member.remarks: Converts ~ to the requesting application path. Mimics the behavior of the Control.ResolveUrl() method, which is often used by control developers.
member.returns: A resolved URL. If the input parameter url contains ~, it is replaced with the value of the appPath parameter.

member.name: T:MySoft.Web.BaseModuleRewriter
member.summary: The base class for module rewriting. This class is abstract, and therefore must be derived from.
member.remarks: Provides the essential base functionality for a rewriter using the HttpModule approach.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.BaseModuleRewriter.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Executes when the module is initialized.
member.param: A reference to the HttpApplication object processing this request.
member.remarks: Wires up the HttpApplication's AuthorizeRequest event to the event handler.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.BaseModuleRewriter.BaseModuleRewriter_AuthorizeRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the module's AuthorizeRequest event fires.
member.remarks: This event handler calls the method, passing in the RawUrl and HttpApplication passed in via the sender parameter.

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.BaseModuleRewriter.Rewrite(System.String,System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: The Rewrite method must be overriden. It is where the logic for rewriting an incoming URL is performed.
member.param: The requested RawUrl. (Includes full path and querystring.)

member.name: M:MySoft.Web.ModuleRewriter.Rewrite(System.String,System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: This method is called during the module's BeginRequest event.
member.param: The RawUrl being requested (includes path and querystring).
